title: Paris tourist attractions empty out as visitors flock to Olympic events
summary: Whether they're close to Olympic venues or not, Paris' major museums and attractions are seeing a decline in visitor numbers. This trend can be explained by a change in the type of visitor to the French capital.

title: Paris 2024: France gets revenge on Germany and will meet the US in men's basketball final
summary: France is headed to its second consecutive Olympic gold-medal clash, after beating Germany 73-69. The US overcame a 17-point deficit to defeat Serbia in the second semifinal, later Thursday.

title: Trump recommits to a debate during press conference, rehashes lies, and attacks Harris
summary: Former president and Republican candidate Donald Trump repeatedly suggested Vice President Kamala Harris was not intelligent enough to debate him. He also repeated lies about Jan. 6 and crowd sizes.

title: Boeing welcomes new CEO in wake of space capsule ordeal
summary: Robert Kelly Ortberg, a mechanical engineer by training, must save the American aeronautics giant while the Starliner misadventure threatens the group's entire space program.

title: The lives of Putin's cherished 'illegal' spies
summary: Among the Russians sent back to Moscow in a recent prisoner exchange was a couple who had settled in the West with their children, under false identities. The practice, which dates back to Soviet times, represents an important investment for the Russian state.

title: Musk's misleading election posts viewed 1.2 billion times in 2024 according to report
summary: Researchers from the Center for Countering Digital Hate identified 50 posts since January by Elon Musk with election claims debunked by independent fact-checkers.

title: UN approves its first treaty targeting cybercrime
summary: The treaty was approved Thursday despite fierce opposition from an unusual alliance of human rights activists – warning of potential surveillance dangers – and big tech companies.

title: Table tennis at the 2024 Olympics: Ousted by China, France is eyeing a bronze medal consolation prize
summary: The Lebrun brothers and Simon Gauzy were no slouches in the team event, however, they came up short against the Chinese superstars (3-0). They will face Japan on Friday for third place.

title: Covid-stricken Noah Lyles finishes 3rd in 200 meters won by Botswana's Letsile Tebogo
summary: US Olympic 100m champion Noah Lyles revealed he tested positive two days before Thursday's 200m final. After the finish line, Lyles fell to his back, writhed in pain, and needed a wheelchair. He says he believes this is the 'end' of his Olympics.

title: Left-wing candidate Lucie Castets' strange campaign for France's premiership
summary: Over the two weeks since her name burst onto the French political scene, the Nouveau Front Populaire's candidate for prime minister has been thrust into the limelight and is trying to forge a reputation for herself.

title: Delta Air Lines threatened by class action lawsuit over tech outage
summary: The airline is facing a lawsuit by customers claiming it refused to give refunds following a global tech outage in July. Delta, by far the hardest hit, replied that it would go after the companies behind the snafu.

title: IS suspect planned suicide attack at Taylor Swift Vienna concert, officials say
summary: A 19-year-old Islamic State sympathizer planned to 'kill himself and a large number of people' at an upcoming show by the American pop star, Austria's intelligence agency said on Thursday. Organizers canceled her three planned shows in the city.

title: Tom Cruise at Olympics closing ceremony would be 'disgrace,' say anti-cult groups
summary: French activists have accused Scientologists of proselytizing outside Olympic venues. They say the rumored participation of the famous Scientologist actor would be 'an insult to victims.'

title: Ukrainian army enters Russia in largest-ever incursion
summary: The incursion of some 1,000 Ukrainian troops into the Kursk region on Tuesday and Wednesday was the largest-ever on Russian territory since the start of the war.

title: Anti-racist protesters mobilize against far-right rioters in the UK
summary: Thousands of protesters marched in Liverpool, Newcastle, Bristol and London to protect mosques and immigrant hostels. In Walthamstow, north-east London, anti-migrant demonstrators didn't show up.

title: Yunus sworn in as Bangladeshi prime minister, citing country's 'second independence'
summary: Nobel Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus returned to the country to lead  a caretaker government after deadly protests toppled Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Diplomatic efforts intensify to avoid regional war between Israel and Iran
summary: Tehran still promises a 'firm' response to the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, but hints that a condemnation of Israel by the UN Security Council could obviate the need for a military response.

title: Olympic women's basketball: After beating Germany, France faces familiar Belgium in semi-finals
summary: Thanks to their 84-71 victory on Wednesday, Marine Johannès and her teammates enabled the French women's national team to reach the Olympic semi-finals for the fourth time in a row.

title: Paris 2024: Manizha Talash, the b-girl who defies the Taliban regime through dance
summary: The Afghan dancer fled her country at the age of 19 and now lives in Spain, where she pursues her passion for breakdancing. She is part of the Refugee Olympic Team competing in the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Gaza's Yarmouk stadium, the sports arena turned detention center
summary: The sports venue where Palestinian athletes used to train dreaming of the Olympics was destroyed at the start of the war. Before being converted into a makeshift camp for the displaced, it was used as an interrogation site by the Israeli army.

title: Venezuela: Opposition, US, and allies put pressure on Maduro, he suspends X for 10 days
summary: Election authorities declared Maduro the winner of the July 28 vote but have yet to release detailed results.

title: Tajikistan prohibits 'black clothes' after hijab ban
summary: Autocrat Emomali Rahmon's campaign against radical Islam has intensified since the bloody attack on Moscow's Crocus City Hall in March.

title: Paris 2024: Breaking makes both Olympic debut and final bow
summary: With events on Friday and Saturday, the sports will experience its first and last Olympic moments.

title: Trump holds press conference seeking to retake upper hand against Harris
summary: The Republican said that his rival is 'not smart enough to do a news conference' and painted a bleak picture of America. The Democrat has dominated the news cycle since succeeding Joe Biden in the US presidential race.
